conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a true 3D cutaway: walls have height/thickness, multiple faces are visible, interior volume is readable, and the view is clearly angled with the ceiling removed.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Strong 3D extrusion of walls with visible thickness and clean corner geometry; clear floor-vs-wall separation; good isometric perspective and cutaway. Minor simplification in some wall/opening detailing.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Core spaces (kitchen/living, bedroom, bathroom) exist and are broadly adjacent as in plan, but the right-side stair/entry zone from the 2D plan is not faithfully represented (appears missing or heavily reduced to a small step area). Several door locations/openings do not match the 2D plan, including the main entry not clearly shown.

interior_elements.notes: Major furniture is present (bed, sofa, dining table, kitchen cabinetry/island) and generally placed in appropriate rooms; bathroom fixtures included. Some elements are simplified and not all furnishings from 2D are reflected (e.g., certain built-ins/closets).

visual_clarity.notes: Geometry is clean and readable; openings and room boundaries mostly clear; lighting supports visibility; consistent simple materials and no obvious broken meshes. Presentation/background is clean.

detected_errors.description: Stair/entry area along the right side in the 2D plan is not accurately modeled; the 3D render shows only a small step feature and lacks the distinct stairwell/hall configuration.
Door/opening placement does not fully match the 2D plan (notably the main entry and some interior door positions/orientations).

summary: A valid, clean 3D cutaway with strong fundamentals, but with notable layout fidelity issues—especially the missing/altered right-side stair/entry configuration and some door/opening mismatches.
